intro: Parosela carnescens, commonly known as the red-flowered parosela, is a striking plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its vibrant red petals and distinctive, showy inflorescence. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is known for its aromatic foliage. Parosela carnescens thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or alpine soils. Its unique appearance and ecological significance make it a subject of interest for botanists and plant enthusiasts alike.
